definition:
*Terence Tao* (1975 - ) Australian mathematician, son of Hong Kong
immigrants. As a child, Tao won medals at the International Mathematical
Olympiads. Charles Fefferman calls Tao a mathematical “Mr. It.” His 2004
paper with Ben Green on arithmetic progressions of primes was hailed by
Neil Sloane as a major mathematical landmark. Two years later, Tao
became the first Australian to win the Fields medal.
